name: Teriyaki Steak Rolls
description: My savory Teriyaki Steak Rolls with veggies are pan-seared and glazed with an easy homemade teriyaki sauce. Make this Japanese home-cooked dish for dinner, then enjoy the leftovers in tomorrowâ€˜s bento lunch!
recipeIngredient: Â½ lb thinly sliced beef (chuck or ribeye)

recipeInstructions.text: Peel 3 oz carrot and cut into matchsticks 2 inches long. Trim the ends of 3 oz French green beans (haricots verts).
recipeInstructions.name: Peel 3 oz carrot and cut into matchsticks 2 inches long. Trim the ends of 3 oz French green beans (haricots verts).

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a small saucepan of water to a boil. Once boiling, add the carrots and cook for 1â€“2 minutes, then add the green beans to cook another minute. The cooking time may vary depending on the amount and thickness of the vegetables. Drain well and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring a small saucepan of water to a boil. Once boiling, add the carrots and cook for 1â€“2 minutes, then add the green beans to cook another minute. The cooking time may vary depending on the amount and thickness of the vegetables. Drain well and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Place a slice of meat on the cutting board and sprinkle it with Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Then, put a few green beans and carrots on one end of the meat and start rolling it up. Repeat with the remaining Â½ lb thinly sliced beef (chuck or ribeye) and vegetables.
recipeInstructions.name: Place a slice of meat on the cutting board and sprinkle it with Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Then, put a few green beans and carrots on one end of the meat and start rolling it up. Repeat with the remaining Â½ lb thinly sliced beef (chuck or ribeye) and vegetables.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all the ingredients for the teriyaki sauce: 3 Tbsp soy sauce, 2 Tbsp sugar, 2 Tbsp sake, and 1 Tbsp mirin. Mix well to dissolve the sugar.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine all the ingredients for the teriyaki sauce: 3 Tbsp soy sauce, 2 Tbsp sugar, 2 Tbsp sake, and 1 Tbsp mirin. Mix well to dissolve the sugar.

itemListElement.text: In a frying pan, heat 1 Tbsp neutral oil on medium-high heat. When itâ€™s hot, place the steak rolls gently in the pan with the seam side down. Cook one side of the rolls until nicely charred, then rotate to cook the next side.Â
itemListElement.name: In a frying pan, heat 1 Tbsp neutral oil on medium-high heat. When itâ€™s hot, place the steak rolls gently in the pan with the seam side down. Cook one side of the rolls until nicely charred, then rotate to cook the next side.Â

itemListElement.text: Once all sides of the meat have a nice char, reduce the heat to medium and add 2 Tbsp sake. Cook covered until the sake is evaporated.Â
itemListElement.name: Once all sides of the meat have a nice char, reduce the heat to medium and add 2 Tbsp sake. Cook covered until the sake is evaporated.Â

itemListElement.text: Add the teriyaki sauce and rotate the steak rolls so they are evenly coated with the sauce. Transfer the steak rolls to a serving plate.Â
itemListElement.name: Add the teriyaki sauce and rotate the steak rolls so they are evenly coated with the sauce. Transfer the steak rolls to a serving plate.Â

itemListElement.text: Reduce the teriyaki sauce in half, or until itâ€˜s thickened. Drizzle the sauce on the steak rolls and serve immediately.
itemListElement.name: Reduce the teriyaki sauce in half, or until itâ€˜s thickened. Drizzle the sauce on the steak rolls and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Made this tonight.  Wow! Super yum! You said the could be other fillings.  What would you suggest? Thank you for sharing your knowledge and expertise.
I prepare these rolls filled with some asparagus. Soo delicious! We will prepare them once again ðŸ˜‹
We made these two kinds of theselast night; one with asparagus and the other with kimchi.  Wonderful flavor and so easy.
